reviews.text: We traveled here as a family. Teenager and child. Great location. I can see Field Museum from my window. Small rooms (even "executive suites") Bad housekeeping though. Had to ask numerous times for more than one washcloth. Last day they didnt leave coffee. Left trashcan sitting on chair and much more. Rooms are small, but affordable (in general). They didn't tell us ahead of time that there is a $50 deposit for incidentals. Average and okay for a base of operations for a family touring the area. Metra station is right across the road.
reviews.title: Okay, but bad housekeeping

reviews.text: We stayed for two nights at this hotel. The reception staff were very helpful, courteous and friendly.
reviews.title: A reasonable hotel to stay

reviews.text: Rooms are good and reasonably priced. Free internet service is offered in the lobby and in rooms.
reviews.title: Great value close to the loop for business

reviews.text: There is only one restaurant and the quality of food is not that great.
reviews.title: Very Different View of Chicago

reviews.text: Overall, a good hotel to stay.
reviews.title: Great value for the money and location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Unless you are planning to spend a great deal of time in your room the Grant Park Hotel was fine. I was part of a group tour so , of course, the price was right. The room had everything we needed including a great view from rm. 904. The pillows others griped about must have been replaced and there wer THREE on each bed (we had 2). We had no noise problem and since I had read other reviews complaing about the thin walls I took some earplugs but never got them out of the package. We pulled up in a motorcoach of 4r people and our rooms were quickly assigned and the luggage was delivered very quickly.
reviews.title: Don't worry about other reviews

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had in included breakfast at Mei's Kitchen, the attached restaurant which was buffet style and OK. As to other meals the service can be slow. But a late night pizza just before they closed was promptly served.
reviews.title: VERY GOOD

reviews.text: The location is very good EXCEPT for the miimal amount of places close by to dine. Head north for some better choices.
reviews.title: Great hotel at a reasonable cost.

reviews.text: The hotel did the job fine. The room was big, with a very nice view, close to the museun campus, Soldier Field and the subway. We were going to the football game, so it was very convenient and full of Bears fans. There is a very nice breakfast place at the corner: YOLK.
reviews.title: Old hotel, cramped and lacking in amenities

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: CHICAGO IS AWESOME!
reviews.title: Great location, great value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed here for an overnight sightseeing stop before visiting relatives. We requested and fortunately received a lake-view room. We were lucky to arrive on the only nice summer-like day to walk through the park and see a few sights.
reviews.title: Best Lake/park view value

reviews.text: The hotel staff were exceptional and efficient. Check-in and Check-out was quick and easy. They stored our luggage after checkout so we could see a few more sights before leaving town.
reviews.title: Reasonable Price, No frills

reviews.text: Location is very convenient. Very short walk from Orange & Red line stations as well as the MTA? and Shorline train station. We did this with our roll-along luggage in tow no problem.
reviews.title: No-Frills but reasonable, clean and great location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There are TA pictures posted of the room decor. Fortunately they ditched the beadspread that matches the drapes. Ours was white and the look and feel was much improved from the impression I had from the pictures. We almost did not stay here because of that but the value and location made it the right choice an we were not disappointed.
reviews.title: Hotel deal in downtown Chicago

reviews.text: The only downside to the room was the lack of an exhaust fan in the bathroom. Most of these hotels are in OLD buildings so there is little to be done for that. Other nearby hotels likely have the same issue.
reviews.title: Rocky start, but good finish.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was just fine. Nothing fancy, no complaints. Clean, staff was helpful, internet didn't work, but we used an unsecured link instead of the Best Western one and it worked. Ate at the attached restaurant for breakfast and everything was good.
reviews.title: Worked for me!

reviews.text: Great location, right near the museum campus and next door to Yolk, my new favorite restaurant. The room was small for two beds and had incredibly small pillows, but it was clean! The bathroom needs a vent because the ceiling above the shower looked like it was starting to crumble a little. The internet is pretty slow, which was a bit of a downer. The hallways smell like old college dorm, but it does have parking ($24 a night) which we thought was a great plus. For the price and the location, I thought this was a great hotel.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.text: The hotel staff was very informative and friendly. The room was available upon arrival and it was very clean. The location is in a great spot...within walking distance of Museum Campus as well as other attractions. I would stay there again.
reviews.title: Great experience all around

reviews.text: It is a run down hotel. They need to completely renovate it. I was afraid to sit on the toilet cause it seemed it would break. everything in the room was old. This place is in need of some major upgrades. The restaurant is very bad too. Stay away from this dump.
reviews.title: Do not stay at this hotel
Great Location - Nice Stay
reviews.text: My husband and I and our son and his girlfriend stayed at Best Western Grant Park the weekend of November 5-7. Our son was auditioning for America's Got Talent, which was held at McCormick Convention Center. The BWGP was a great location for everything we did on the weekend. The staff was very nice, and made a great recommendation for a place nearby to eat, The Eleven City Diner. The room rate and parking rate were very reasonable. The only complaint - we had four to our room and not enough towels. But that was remedied after we requested more. Would highly recommend BWGP and would definitely stay there again.
